required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlating Time-Lapse Parameters Detected by the Eeva™ System With Comprehensive Chromosome Screening Results
clinical_study.official_title: Correlating Time-Lapse Parameters Detected by the Eeva™ System With Comprehensive Chromosome Screening Results,Implantation and Live Birth

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study protocol is to collect imaging data on embryos followed to blastocyst stage (Day 5-6) and correlate Eeva System parameters with comprehensive chromosome screening (CCS) results, implantation and live birth.

detailed_description.textblock: The present study was designed to determine if there is a correlation between the Eeva System parameters and CCS results. Embryos will be selected for transfer based on CCS results and morphology. The Clinical site will have no access to the Eeva analysis at the time of the transfer.

primary_outcome.description: Analyse the correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and comprehensive chromosome screening (CCS) results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and implantation rate.
Correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and clinical pregnancy rate
Correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and ongoing pregnancy rate
Correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and delivery rate
Correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and spontaneous miscarriage rate
Correlation of time-lapse parameters collected by the Eeva System and multiple pregnancy rate

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women undergoing IVF treatment and CCS
arm_group.description: •Women undergoing fresh IVF treatment and undergoing CCS, as recommended based on medical need by the clinical site reproductive endocrinologist.

study_pop.textblock: Women undergoing fresh IVF treatment and undergoing CCS, as recommended based on medical need by the clinical site reproductive endocrinologist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is ≤43 years of age.
- Women undergoing fresh IVF treatment using her own eggs or donor eggs and undergoing CCS, as recommended based on medical need by the clinical site reproductive endocrinologist.
- Fertilization using only ejaculated sperm (fresh or frozen) - no surgically retrieved sperm.
- Willing to have all 2PN embryos monitored by Eeva
- Not previously enrolled in this study.
- No concurrent participation in another clinical study.
- Willing to comply with study protocol and procedures and able to speak English.
- Willing to provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI ≥ 40
- Prior IVF cycle with < 4 x 2PN
- Diminished ovarian reserve as demonstrated by any one of the following:
- BAFC < 6 at time of cycle start
- Maximum prior FSH > 15
- AMH < 0.5

overall_official.affiliation: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey
